com.xamoom.android.xamoomcontentblocks

Class XamoomContentFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • com.xamoom.android.xamoomcontentblocks.XamoomContentFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, ContentBlock3ViewHolder.OnContentBlock3ViewHolderInteractionListener

    public class XamoomContentFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements ContentBlock3ViewHolder.OnContentBlock3ViewHolderInteractionListener
    XamoomContentBlock is a helper for everyone to display the different contentBlocks delivered from the xamoom cloud. ATM there are nine different contentBlocks displaying different contents from the customer. In your app you can display the contentBlocks like you want, we decided to display them like on our website (https://www.xm.gl). To get started with the XamoomContentFragment create a new Instance via newInstance(String). You also have to adapt XamoomContentFragment.OnXamoomContentFragmentInteractionListener. There are two ways to use this class. You can set an identifier (contentId or locationIdentifier), this fragment will download it and display it, when added to an activity. Or you can set the content and the fragment will display that.

        public void setContent(Content content,
                       boolean addHeader,
                       boolean offline)
        Sets the content to display when fragment gets loaded.
        Parameters:
        content - Content to display.
        addHeader - Adds header (content title and content image).
        offline - Will notify contentBlocks to use offline functioniality and remove offline unavailable contentBlocks.
